Replies.Reply: You don't mind that I'm not coming tonight?
I thought I'd stay home and read.
Wake me up when you get home.
I don't know... There's no return address on the envelope... In fact, there's no address on it.
It must be from a real estate agent.
Oh. Oh, yeah.  No. This is a different one.
I must have fallen asleep.  I was asleep when you got home, wasn't I?
I told you you could wake me up if you wanted to.
That dog woke me.  I lay there for a while, then decided to get up.
Yes, I just found it on the step.
We've got to call the police.
...yes, I've been on hold for ten minutes... I can't... All right, thanks.
Hello, yes... Good... My name is Renee Madison... My husband is Fred Madison, the jazz musician... we	live at 442 Hollis Street... Right... 442 Hollis...
Yes, actually we do... but we haven't been using it.
No, one of us is always here to let the maid in.  Nobody else has a key.
What the hell is going on?!
On the tape!  There was something else on the tape.
Why would anyone do something like this?
I don't know if I want to stay here.  I don't feel safe.
I don't know. maybe a hotel.
Acting paranoid?!!! Someone is in our house while we're sleeping, filming us, and you don't want to act paranoid?!!! I thought you set the alarm!
But that doesn't solve the problem.  Who is doing this?  And why?
I thought you were getting me a drink?
It was a long time ago... I met him at this place called Moke's... We... became friends... He told me about a job...
I don't remember... Anyway, Andy's okay...
Why? what is it?  Why did you make me wait out here?
It's so odd... Waiting out there, I had the strangest feeling... Like this had happened before.  I mean, your telling me to stay outside while you went in like that.
What are you going to do?
It's nice to know I can still make you laugh.
Does it say anything on the tape?
Well, let's see what's on it.
Same one you were reading the other night?
When you didn't come to the club.
From the club.  You didn't answer.
You were asleep when I got home, yes.
I had a dream about you last night...
You were in the house... calling my name... but I couldn't find you.
Who the hell owns that dog?
Don't you want to watch it?
Well, do you wanna watch it?
No... There is, I mean, I use it as a practice room... it's soundproofed.
I like to remember things my own way.
How I remember them.  Not necessarily the way they happened.
It kept going off for some reason.  False alarms.
No, I don't remember anything. it looks like I... but... I don't remember.
The first night ... Not the last two.
I forgot.  Anyway, I hate the idea of acting paranoid.
I'll make sure the alarm is set from now on.
I don't think so.  Where was it that you think we've met?
No, no I don't.  Are you sure?
What do you mean?  You're where right now?
How did you get into my house?
But Dick Laurent is dead, isn't he?
I don't.  I don't know him.
Now!  We're leaving now! I didn't want to come here in the first place.
How'd you meet that asshole, Andy, anyway?
He's got some fucked up friends.
I told you to stay in the car!
I thought there might be somebody inside.
I didn't kill her! Tell me I didn't kill her!
No, no.  I want to go in.
The pain is getting worse.  I need more aspirin.
Aspirin... fly head.  I gotta have more aspirin.
Let's have a look at the hallway outside the bedroom.
How'd the camera get so high like that?
Like you'd get if it was hand held.
Do you have an alarm system?
Might be a good time to try using it again.
Let's check the doors and windows... See if there's been a break-in.
We'll take the tapes with us, if that's all right with you?
Did you use the alarm system since we were here last?
'Fucker gets more pussy than a toilet seat.
There's no such thing as a bad coincidence.
The angle.  The high angle shot on the tape.
And smooth... Almost no movement - back and forth, I mean.
Do you always sleep here?... In this room?... Both of you?
Do you own a video camera?
What do you mean by that?
Anybody else have a key to the house.
We'll keep a watch on the house.
If anything else happens, you'll call us.
You don't remember being awakened?  It looks like you were aware of someone.
Has anyone made any threats to either of you recently?
We'll see that the patrol of the house is doubled.
Now we'll see what this son of a bitch is up to.
It's her, all right.  Fred Madison's wife ... with Dick Laurent and Mr. Dent-
We've got Pete Dayton's prints all over this place.
At your house.  Don't you remember?
Of course.  In fact, I'm there right now.
I told you I was here.
You invited me.  It's not my habit to go where I'm not wanted.
It's been a pleasure talking to you.
Her name is Renee.  If she's told you her name is Alice, she's lying.
AND YOUR NAME, WHAT THE FUCK IS YOUR NAME?!
Now you can hand it back to me.
I don't know his name.  He's a friend of Dick Laurent's, I think.
He is?  I didn't think you knew Dick.
Dick can't be dead.  Who told you he was dead?
Hi, doc. Workin' late tonight, huh?
I don't know if I can watch this.
You talking to me or... her?
Please hand it to the bailiff.
Fred Madison, the jury having found you guilty of murder in the first degree, it is my order that on a date to be determined, you be put to death in the electric chair.
We the jury find the defendant guilty of murder in the first degree.
Did you see that about the guy who chopped up his wife into a million pieces?
Do they aim for the head or for the heart?
I wouldn't... The brain would know what's going on.  Your heart would be ripped open trying to pump blood, blood pouring into the chest cavity.  Savage pain, Marian.
Absolutely... Soon as your neck snaps, you black out.  It might take a while for the body to die, but you wouldn't feel it.
How could I miss it?  The TV won't quit with that stuff.
Andy's from Utah.  He says there you have a choice... You can die by hanging or by firing squad.
Andy would go for this, don't you think?... Firing squad, definitely.
Oh, that's hot... So you'd rather be hung, huh?
Headache, huh?  Too much sun, I guess. You want to come in?  Still got forty-
I can't give you anymore.  I'll talk to the doctor.
The doctor said not to give you anything.
Who are you?  What are you doing in this cell?
Of course, it's Madison!!! Who else could it be?
Did you ask him who he is?
If he's not Madison, then where's Madison?
I want to take a look at this man myself.
Where the hell did you come from, mister?
Well, gentlemen, we know who the stranger is. His name is Peter Raymond Dayton.
years ago for auto theft, for which he was put on probation for one year.  That was his first and only offense.  No record since then.
How the hell does she know?
What's the word on the street?
Good, let's keep it that way.  Keep a lid on Dayton.  Nothing gets out about him.

I have a statement to read... Fred Madison, an inmate being held on death row has, apparently... has escaped.  An all-points bulletin has been issued to authorities not only statewide, but nationwide.  We are confindent that he will be apprehended very soon.  No further details are available at this time.  Thank you very much.
I'm Warden Clements.  This is Captain Henderson and Dr. Rogoff.  Please, sit down.
Mr. and Mrs. Dayton, as you were told over the phone, your son, Peter, is here.
He... He was discovered this morning...
A cell that was supposed to be occupied by an inmate named Fred Madison.
...Tell me, what was Peter's condition the last time you saw him?
You say you haven't seen your son since the day before yesterday?
Yes, and we need to talk to him... if we can.
Mel, let's get Peter in here.
Pete, can you tell us now, anything about this?
A man named Fred Madison was occupying that cell.  He's missing. we're trying to find out how it is you were in there and not him.
All right... but you see our predicament... Legally we can't hold him, but he may be able to help us...
We'll get a tail put on him.
Take him back to his cell.
I couldn't say, sir... Captain Henderson?
Warden, it's not him.  It .was not Fred Madison in that cell.
I don't know.  The guards say they've never seen him before.
He's in the infirmary, being examined.
He... He can't talk. it appears as if he can't talk, anyway.
I've got men searching the building and the grounds now.
Nothing, Marsh.  Vanished.  There's an APB out on him.  His photo's been faxed nationwide.
One of the guards must have leaked it.
Do you think Pete knows him?
We need to find out what happened here.
You just gonna let him go?
Warden, nobody's ever escaped from death row before.  How did he get out?
His condition?  What do you mean?
Same as always.  Pete takes care of himself.
No... Only what was in the news.
Sometimes he stays at a friend's.
A girl's, a buddy's.  I don't know.  He's his own man; he comes and goes as he pleases.
Have you made any charges against him?
Then he's coming home with his mother and me.
Just rest easy, Pete. You're gonna be okay.
Arnie called this morning while you were sleepin'.  They miss you pretty bad down at the garage.  I told 'im you still had a "fever".
Nice to know they can't seem to get along without ya.
You really don't remember the other night, do you?
The night before you showed up in the slammer...
They wanted to know if we'd had a chance to find out what happened to you the other night.  They wanted to know if you remembered anything.
You came home.  Your friend Sheila brought you here.
Yes, there was a man with you... She brought you here... She didn't know what else to do.
Never saw him before in my life.
We're not saying anything about that night to the police. We should all forget that night.
Why don't you two come inside and talk things over quietly... Come on... Come on in, Sheila.
I saw him before he went to the garage day before yesterday.  He's a mechanic. Look, is he okay?  Can we see him?
But what is the cause then? ... And how did he get in that cell?
When he went to work, right.
It's okay.  Take your time, honey.
Warden, can we take him home?
Are you hungry, honey?  I'll fix you something.
We saw you that night, Pete.
Pete... There's a man on the phone.  He's called a couple of times tonight.
No... I don't feel so good.  I would like some aspirin.
Where to?  Hey, Lanie, I heard you were out of it for a while, too.
Goin' out with these clowns for a while.
I hate ridin' in this fuckin' car.
This rod is a fuckin, embarrassment, Carl.  Whatiya burn in this thing, "V"?
Guess we're goin' over to the "Ten Pin".
I don't remember... What happened that night?
Who else could I be7  Sheila stares seriously at Pete, but then laughs too.
What else about that night?... Did anything happen?
Feeling good, Arnie.  Ready to get to work.
Sure, Arnie.  Bring 'em on, I'm ready.
No, it's nothin'... I'm all right.
No, no... It's okay, Mr. Eddy.
Thanks, Mr. Eddy ... whatiya need?  Just the regular tune-up?
No, it's not the carburetors.  Pull over, but keep it runnin'.
Eight, nine car lengths.  A hundred and sixty-two feet.
Fifteen car lengths.  About two hundred and seventy feet.
Okay... Well, I'll see ya then.
Sure... Sure, Mr. Eddy.  You gonna pick it up later, or tomorrow?
Nothin'... You want to go for a drive?
Look, I don't think it's a good idea.
We won't be needing a cab, thanks anyway.
Yeah... Call me at home.  I'll give you the number.
I've been here.  You were lookin, right at me.
I gotta headache... What's goin' on?
But I don't remember anything.  What did you tell 'em?
What is this? Why didn't you tell me?
Did you tell the police this?
Why didn't you tell me you brought me here that night?
To my house... my parents told me.  What are you tryin' to hide?
Sheila... Tell me... Who was with me?...
We should stop seeing each other.
How'd you get in with these fuckin' people?
I don't want you to go away.
Why are ya goin' so early?
What if Andy tips off Mr. Eddy?
What about tonight?... Whatiya gonna do about Mr. Eddy tonight?
Sheila, what is it?... What are you doin' here?
Look... It's late, Mr. Eddy... I ...
I don't think so.  Where was it that you think we've met?
Is that you?  Are both of them you?
Why me, Alice?  Why choose me?
I want you... I want you...
Take it easy, Pete, "V" loves this rod.
They found a cyst on my god damn ovary. Had to cut it out.  You wanna see the scar?
What's happening to you?  What happened to your face?
What do you mean? ... You've been acting strange lately ... Like the other night.
You sure weren't acting like the Pete Dayton I've always known.
You were acting like a different person.
I don't want to talk about it...
No... I really don't want to talk about it.
You've been fucking somebody else haven't you?
You fuck me whenever you want... You don't call... Tell me who she is.
YOU'RE SORRY!! YOU PIECE OF SHIT!!
I don't care anyway... I'm sorry, Mr. Dayton... I won't bother you or any member of your family again.
Wonderful!!... Wonderful to see you, Pete.  How are you?
Wonderful, Pete.  Really wonderful. Alotta people Pete... alotta people are gonna be very happy.
Mr. Smith has been waiting for you and Mrs. Trueworthy.  Can you take care of Mr. Smith now?
Mr. Eddy's called every day... Can I call him to come in?
Why'd you change it?  I liked that.
How would you like to take me to dinner?
Okay, then, I'll take you to dinner.
Where's your phone?  I have to call another taxi.
Can you give me the number for United Cab?
Yes, I need a taxi at Arnie's Auto Repair, the corner of Fifth and...
I have to go somewhere with Mr. Eddy.
Meet me at the Starlight Motel on Sycamore... I'll be there in twenty minutes.
I'm not positive... but... he knows.
I don't want to live without you.
We have to get away... We have to get some money.
I know a guy... He pays girls to party with him... He always has alotta cash...
He'd be easy to rob... Then we'd have the money... and we could get away ... We'd be together.
No, honey... It was part of the deal.
He makes films for Mr. Eddy.
It was a long time ago... I met someone at this place called Moke's... we became friends.  He told me about a job...
No... A job... I didn't know what.  He set up an appointment for me to see a man.
weights... Both these guys gave me the creeps... They never said anything to me... So I just smoked cigarettes and waited.
If you want me to go away, I'll go away.
That's his name...Andy.  Our ticket out of here.
I'll set it up for tomorrow night. You'll meet me at his place at eleven o'clock... Don't drive there... Take a bus ... Make sure no one follows you...
Lemme call him now.  Make sure he's not already busy tomorrow night.
Andy?... It's me, Alice.  How ya doin?...
Andy... I can get away tomorrow night...
'Cause that's how long it's gonna take, baby.
Are you kidding?... I've got so much on Andy, it isn't funny.
I'm not goin' home tonight ... I'm goin' somewhere else..
But, we still have a coupla things to take care of...
Are you gonna be a man about this, Pete?
It was an accident... Accidents happen every day.
We gotta get the stuff and get out of here.
Up the stairs - down the hall.
Look at all this shit... I know a fence... he'll give us money and get us passports in exchange for this and the car...
We have to go to the desert.  He's at his cabin.
So we can be together... You still want to be with me, don't you Pete?
At your house.  Don't you remember?
We just killed a couple of people...
You heard me... We thought we'd come over and tell you about it.

Great question!! In the east ... the far east... when a person is sentenced to death... they're sent to a place where they can't escape... never knowing when an executioner will step up behind them and fire a bullet into the back of their head... it could be days... weeks... or even years after the death sentence has been pronounced... This uncertainty adds an exquisite element of torture to the situation, don't you think?  It's been a pleasure talking to you.
You just got in before the big storm hits.
